meanings.definition: Intifadas: plural noun, a Palestinian uprising against Israeli occupation in the late 20th and early 21st centuries.
meanings.sent1: During the intifadas, many Palestinians protested against the occupation.
meanings.sent2: The intifadas in history books show the struggle for freedom.
meanings.sent3: The intifadas seemed like a loud wake-up call to the world.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was an intifadas against injustice.
meanings.sent5: The intifadas roared like a lion demanding its rights.

meanings.definition: Intifadas: verb, to engage in a violent uprising against authority.
meanings.sent1: The citizens intifadas against the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent2: People intifadas when they feel their rights are violated.
meanings.sent3: He intifadas every time he disagrees with the rules.
meanings.sent4: Their anger intifadas like a storm brewing in the distance.
meanings.sent5: To intifadas is to stand up and fight for what you believe in.
